intro: Aeschynomene tricholoma, commonly known as the hairy sicklegrass, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and trifoliate leaves, which are typically hairy and have a distinctive sickle shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Aeschynomene tricholoma is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, making it an important plant in soil enrichment and ecological restoration efforts.
